And it's not that I disagree with that, but I don't think of it as an either-or, either we do that or we do this.

My idea is that we need to encourage that, but in the meantime we also can look at what can be done as a society - what we can do in a purposeful, structured way as a culture, as a society, as a city to encourage, you know, better from our children and better for our children.

And the thing that really concerns me when we talk about programs, you know, having such a stigma for African-American kids is that this country has historically used social programs to socially engineer desirable results.
